title: Do you marvel at the reality of your conscious awareness and identity? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. How does the physical world bring subjective sensations to consciousness? I don't know but the words in which we report subjective consciousness sensations owes its meaning to their connections with the physical world. Without connections with the physical world there isn't independent criteria for the re-identification of subjective consciousness sensations. Without independent criteria there aren't correct and wrong concepts, and therefore subjective consciousness sensations cannot be conceptualized. Checking our own consciousness to see if we are following subjective sensations concepts correctly, without independent criteria, it is like we correct our own school test, without external correction what seems correct is correct, there isn't wrong concepts. It is unverifiable performance by us.  If what exactly constitute a supposed subjective consciousness is in principle incapable of translation into ordinary language concepts, then the person is unable to make sense of it for us and for himself too. Understanding is only possible on the basis of similar forms of life and  a supposed radical difference between subjective consciousness experiences would therefore also preclude any correct or incorrect independent concepts for us and for the person. Theories of consciousness need to be a  matter of public empirical investigation. Sometimes when the situation in question is particularly bizarre, involving peculiar drugs, brain operations, other animals, and so on, we might well feel, not merely that we do not know what is being experienced, but that there is no determinate fact of the matter. It does not matter that one cannot experience other people's subjective consciousness sensations. Unless the talk of such subjective experience is learned through public experience the actual content is irrelevant; all we can discuss is what is available in our public language meanings. To know the meaning of a word is to know how to use it rightly; and where there can be no check on how a man uses a word there is no room to talk of "right" and "wrong" use. To understand the meaning of words like "mind," "thought," "love," "belief," and so forth, we must attend to how these words are actually learned in the first place.

When something extraordinary happen or when it is quite peaceful moment ( what I call the perfect second of harmony) of course! How you can not?  A butterfly crossing my road .Magie is everywhere. And I don't even speak when you are in love: all the world change! ( doesn't matter how long it last. When your daughter give you a grand son...And you can see the cycles of life and you see that all your values are transmitted. And you will think I lived for something great. And sometimes , you have to learn the hard way about awareness: The man is an apprentice, pain is his master. And no one knows is as long as it has not suffered. It is a hard law, but a supreme law, old as the world and fate, we have unhappiness receive baptism and to this sad price everything must be purchased... Alfred de Musset  Thank you for the A2A

A2A This question has the word "your" throws me right off being able to answer the question as stated. I have been meditating 40 years and live in almost constant wonderment and amazement. But the question asks about my awareness and consciousness, I can't find it.  I currently do Ramana Maharshi's Self-Inquiry. The only difficulty with this technique is I can't find anything. I keep disappearing.  Life is just wonderment and amazement.

Sometimes. I would say that I'm very interested in conscious awareness and identity in general than I am marveling at my own. What I marvel at is how broken and horrific the world is, but then how it keeps redeeming itself in small ways.

I marvel more at what the Buddhists refer to as emptiness, and which I understand to be the observation of the vastness of existence without the filter of my conscious awareness and identity.  My own consciousness is full of noise, but if you can quiet that to actually observe the world around, what you perceive is marvelous.
Yes I marvel at anything I label as reality.
Yes.  Reality.  Awareness.  Identity?  (Marvel at the mystery of that one)
And marvel at how much of oneself is still asleep, and not conscious at all, until much later, when one wakes up. Consciousness and identity is an expanding landscape.

You live, have sex and reproduce (mostly), eat / shit and die...that's it!Everything else, conscious awareness, identities or lack of it, spirituality power, force, chi, chakras is not relevant and necessary to living.
I do, I think it's amazing that so many unique individuals can come out of the same arrangement of cells and that ideas can come from a bunch of electrical impulses in my head.
All the time. But I don't delude myself in thinking that is the be all and end all of living.
